pages.text: In the year 2023, Hexhaven experienced a lull in membership. $(l:economy/hexhaven_heart)The Heart of Hexhaven$() died due to this neglect, and she remained dormant for months.$(br2)After the extended period of dormancy, people joining and rejoining the server began to question the purpose of The Heart. Thus, $(l:blessbane/blessbane)Blessbane$() was born-- an in-world representation of the toll that prolonged death had on The Heart and the server as a whole.

This initial season was focused on the revival of the true Heart of Hexhaven, requiring Golden Apples to complete. This marked the first $(l:economy/heart_revive)Revival Event$(), requiring 100,000 Golden Apples to complete and push back the creeping influence of §7Blessbane§r.$(br2)The initial concept of §7Blessbane§r was a parasitic alternate universe that sought to pry its roots into the Hexhaven community and siphon away all magic and life in the world.

Within this season, $(l:blessbane/minigames)Minigames$() were provided for easy and fun prizes of tickets which could then be exchanged into Golden Apples and other prizes.$(br2)In addition to Minigames, other sources of Golden Apples were scattered loot chests, but players soon discovered something else among the apples... a series of journals left by an individual known as $(l:blessbane/researcher)The Researcher$(). This Hexhaven resident dedicated his research and time to discovering the origin of Hexhaven's sickness and initially opened the portal to §7Blessbane§r.

During the season, The Heart of Hexhaven appeared dead and lifeless, while $(l:blessbane/root)The Root$() §7Blessbane's§r tree, was lush and teeming with life, magical archwood energy coursing through its trunk.$(br2)The finale of the event caused a permenant severence between The Heart and The Root, with §7Blessbane§r no longer having a source of energy from Hexhaven. The husk of The Root remains among the empty streets of §7Blessbane§r.
